description:
MLB.com At Bat is the official app of Major League Baseball. 

Stay connected to the latest Hot Stove breaking news or re-live the excitement from 2014 with the top sports app of all-time, At Bat. 
NEW: Follow every game live from the All-Star Series 2014 in Japan, scheduled to take place from November 11-20. 
The award-winning At Bat app also delivers 2015 schedules, 2014 scoreboards and complete Winter Meetings coverage and expert analysis of all 30 MLB Clubs.

During the offseason, At Bat Premium subscribers have exclusive access to re-live any regular season or Postseason game from 2014 with full-game video archives and highlights. At Bat Premium also offers classic games archives where subscribers may watch a selection of memorable games from the MLB.com archives. Additional classic games will be made available throughout the offseason.

Stay tuned for exciting announcements and features coming to At Bat 15.

Access At Bat Premium for $2.99 per month. You will be automatically billed $2.99 through iTunes every 30 days until you cancel your subscription. Your subscription automatically renews unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period. Your subscription can be managed and the auto-renewal may be turned off by going to the iTunes Account Settings after purchase. No cancellation of the current subscription is allowed during active subscription period. 

© 2014 MLB Advanced Media, L.P. All Major League Baseball trademarks and copyrights used herein are the property of the applicable MLB entity.  All rights reserved.
releaseNotes:
• Fixes usage issues experienced by some international users
• General performance improvements
Version 7.4.2
• For the first time we will be streaming live every World Series game and select other Postseason games to all authenticated MLB.TV Premium subscribers
• Live Postseason coverage for every game through the 2014 World Series
• Postseason.TV: Live companion coverage featuring up to 10 alternate camera angles for the AL Wild Card, AL Division Series and AL Championship Series (TBS broadcasts only)
• General performance improvements
